The presence of a photograph showing a h: which supports the claim that the house was saved from a fire by sprinklers.
The testimony of the homeowner: Danielle Tajchman, who confirmed that she had been watering her grass for weeks and left her sprinklers running when she evacuated her home as the fire approached.
The statement from Dough Schmitt: the assistant fire chief of the Rile County Fire District, who explained that firefighters soaked down the property to protect it from the fire.
The confirmation of the timeline provide: stating that she did not leave her house until 7:15 p.m. and a neighbor's video showing the property burning was taken at 7:30 p.m., indicating that the sprinklers were indeed running during the fire.
